Broad Cairn

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Broad Cairn is part of the vast, rolling Mounth plateau. Most conveniently climbed from Loch Muick, it is best seen from that direction.

 You have not climbed Broad Cairn.

Region: Cairngorms

Altitude: 998 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.07/5
Rating: 3.1/5 (103 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

The White Mounth Munros circuit

Creag an Dubh Loch and Broad Cairn, Glenmuick

Other routes and challenges

A shorter route is simply to climb Broad Cairn using the track from the Spittal of Glenmuick - used as the descent route in the descriptions above. Cairn Bannoch could also be included.

A more unusual approach would be from the head of Glen Clova in Angus. Head up to Bachnagairn, then up over Broad Cairn and Cairn Bannoch; a descent can be made via Crow Craigies.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Braemar Hotels

Braemar B&B

Cairngorms hostels
